question.title: Hibernate seems to ignore the dialect I specify
question.body:
I'm using Olingo JPA for producing an OData API.

The database I'm connecting to doesn't support the 'LOCATE' function; instead it implements 'POSITION'.

This seems to be true of a few databases: postgres, sqlserver and snowflake.

I have set the dialect using properties, for example:

spring.data.jdbc.dialect=postgresql
spring.jpa.properties.hibernate.dialect=org.hibernate.dialect.PostgreSQLDialect
spring.jpa.database-platform=org.hibernate.dialect.PostgreSQLDialect

I can see that org.hibernate.dialect.PostgreSQLDialect calls functionFactory.locate_positionSubstring();

I can also see that the SqlServerDialect calls functionFactory.locate_charindex();

My understanding of these is that for PostgreSQLDialect it should use the position function, and for SqlServerDialect, it should use the charindex function instead of locate.

However, when I turn on logging (spring.jpa.show-sql=true), I am seeing logs like: SELECT COUNT(E0.id) S0 FROM MY_TABLE E0 WHERE (LOCATE(?, E0.value) <> ?)

This is because the Olingo library v2 uses a criteriabuilder and calls locate on it here.

Is my expectation that these dialects (or if I implement my own) should cause hibernate to not call the database with a LOCATE function, but instead use charindex or position? Why is it still sending LOCATE queries (Which then fail)?
